attributes.action: establish hedges on central reservations of motorways and dual carriageways.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Purposes
   To Reduce	 
     –glare and spray from oncoming traffic 
     –noise
     –visual impact of major roads by day & night
     –rubbernecking in event of accident

   To Aid road safety 
     –oncoming glare is tiring and reduces visibility for drivers     
     –rubbernecking is a major cause of secondary accidents

    To Promote conservation & biodiversity.
 
Many major European roads have hedges between carriageways and are more pleasant and less tiring to drive on than UK roads. 

Space or regulations (visibility) would permit hedges to be established along most motorways or dual-carriageways.  

The principle should be that, forthwith, hedges be established in every instance where visibility considerations permit and:
    a)	where double crash barriers exist or;
    b)	where crash barriers are being replaced or;
    c)	where new dual-carriageways or motorways are being constructed – easily accommodated at the design stage.
